item.title: 7 Most Idealistic Horror Game Characters
item.description:
Summary

  • Laura from Silent Hill 2 firmly believes in the power of apologies, showcasing her idealistic nature.
  • Jennifer from Rule of Rose remains kind to those who don't do the same, demonstrating her ideals despite mistreatment.
  • Mayu's willingness to die to save her village in Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterfly reflects her strong sense of idealism.

Horror games always come with the intention of frightening their players witless, with the player character often being confronted with all sorts of terrifying monsters, unsettling locations, and horrific situations that will put both their body and mind through the paces. As such, it is all too easy for characters in horror games to become jaded, losing grip on all hope and optimism.

But this isn't the case for all characters in horror games, as there are some who rise above the challenge and keep that flickering ember of idealism alive in their heart. The dangers and death that surround them may even drive them to cling harder to their morals.

7 Laura (Silent Hill 2)

Believes An Apology Can Fix Everything

Laura is one of the more surprising Silent Hill 2 characters, as who would expect to see a child running around alone in a town full of monsters? Still, Laura never seems to find herself in real danger, and she views James as a monster when she learns the truth behind Mary's passing, though she can be a little mean-spirited, teasing Eddie and locking James in a room with a monster just for calling her a liar.

Still, she has those ideals that only a child lacking the experience of life can hold, as shown in one telling conversation she has with Eddie. Eddie reveals he had trouble with the law and is on the run for his wrong-doings, to which Laura questions why he doesn't just apologize for what he did. This shows that Laura is someone who definitely would apologize when she is in the wrong, having a very basic grasp between right and wrong.

6 Jennifer (Rule Of Rose)

Shows Kindness Even To Those Who Would Not Extend Her The Same Courtesy

One of the most infamous PS2 horror games of all time is Rule of Rose . False rumors of its contents caused it to be banned in the UK, and the rarity of the game pushed its cost into the hundreds. Those who are lucky enough to have a copy have no doubt experienced the story of Jennifer and her torment at the hands Red Crayon Aristocrat Club, a group of students who have formed a club with its own hierarchy.

Despite the amount of bullying and mistreatment Jennifer endures, she still remains one of the kindest and most caring game characters of all time, which truly shows the strength of her idealistic values. She would never even stand up to those who bully or humiliate her, as she believes everyone deserves kindness and is determined to remain polite to everyone around her.

5 Mayu Amakura (Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterfly)

Mayu is Prepared To Die To Save The Village

Fatal Frame 2 is often viewed as the best entry in the franchise, and it has gone down in history as one of the best horror games of all time. Frightening ghosts and a tragic story are both at the heart of the title, which sees twin sisters Mio and Mayu stumbling upon an old ghost town with the forlorn name of the "Lost Village." As someone sensitive to the paranormal, Mayu is vulnerable to possession, which she suffers while she and Mio explore the village.

It is the possession that reveals the honest truth to Mayu: If she wants to be one with her beloved sister and save the village, the ritual must be completed. Though the willingness to embrace death as a solution is a rather nihilistic outlook, Mayu's reasons are what make her so idealistic. She believes she can save the village, and she is more than willing to do so, even if it means making the ultimate sacrifice.

4 Samantha Giddings (Until Dawn)

One Of The More Compassionate Members Of The Group

Until Dawn was Supermassive's first foray into horror. It plays on all the B-horror movie tropes and features one heck of a surprise twist that shocked many players, especially since most thought they had already sussed out the major twist of the game regarding the identity of the masked killer. Starring a group of high school students, the group reconvenes at the Washington's mountain lodge on the anniversary of the disappearance of twin sisters Hannah and Beth. An exciting party turns into a massacre, however, when the group is beset by a masked killer and monsters.

Each character is designed to be entirely different from the others, with a few core traits making up the majority of their personality. There is the selfish and demanding Emily, the funny, lighthearted Chris, and the kind and compassionate Sam. As the final girl of the game, she is designed with the typical innocent yet tough final-girl persona and was one of the few characters who didn't partake in the mean-spirited prank.

3 Fran Bow

Is Determined To Have Her Happily Ever After

Poor Fran didn't have an easy time of it, seeing her parents' dismembered bodies in what should have been the safety of their home. She is taken to Oswald Asylum and administered medicine in order to help her deal with the psychological trauma of what she witnessed, only to see horrors that push the limits of human comprehension. She stumbles from nightmare to nightmare, visiting multiple other worlds that might be real or might be hallucinations brought on by her prescription.

Despite all this, Fran never loses her inquisitive nature or her care for her beloved cat, Mr. Midnight, revealing an idealistic side to the young girl. Even after all she endured, Fran resolves at the end of the game to lead a happy life, and if she keeps this outlook up, she is sure to have her happily ever after.

2 Leon S. Kennedy (Resident Evil 2)

The Rookie Cop Wants To Save Everyone

Resident Evil 2 saw Leon's introduction to the franchise, where he played the role of a rookie cop preparing for his first day on the job at RPD. Though Leon becomes a little rougher around the edges in follow-up games, RE2 features the character when he was a fresh-faced and earnest young man, who likely took the job as a way of helping people on a day-to-day basis.

He could not have possibly been prepared for what awaited him as he reached Raccoon City, which was beset by hordes of flesh-hungry zombies and other monstrosities even inside the police station. Even so, Leon expresses an earnest desire to keep those around him safe, and he still believes in justice, going as far as to chastise a prisoner behind bars even in the life or death situation they are in.

1 Clementine (The Walking Dead)

Possess The Innocence Of Youth

The world of The Walking Dead leaves little room for idealism, as it has plunged into a full-blown apocalypse, and the dead rise from their graves to satiate their hunger for the flesh of the living. Even survivors sometimes turn to banditry and blackmail, stealing supplies from other survivors just so they can be assured of their own survival. This has been explored in both the TV show on numerous occasions and also in the Telltale game.

That is not to say that all survivors lose their humanity, and this is no more apparent than with Clementine, the young girl players take under their wing during the first season. As she is just a child, she is rather ill-prepared for the horrors she will have to endure, but she still maintains her big heart and an innocent mind-set of right and wrong, which can be seen when the survivors stumble upon a car full of supplies. Players see her develop and mature as the series goes on, but Clementine still remains idealistic at heart for those she cares about.

item.title: Avowed: Best Reasons To Pick The Fighter Starting Class
item.description:
Summary

  • Choosing Fighter class in Avowed offers great tanking abilities and synergy with companions, making them hard to defeat.
  • Fighters have access to powerful abilities like Charge and Constant Recovery, providing sustain and strong crowd control.
  • Fighters excel in close combat, dealing heavy damage with various weapon choices and can multiclass effectively.

In Avowed , the newest fantasy RPG from Obsidian, players have the freedom to explore the world of Eora, the same setting used in another game by the developer, Pillars of Eternity . However, this time, the isometric camera has been replaced with a first-person perspective, allowing players to experience the adventure from a new point of view.

Before beginning this journey, players must choose their character class, but not in the conventional way seen in other games. Here, this decision is made by selecting specific abilities that define the first hours of gameplay. These are the best reasons for players to choose Fighter as a starting class, combining skills with equipment to create a great tank and an effective damage dealer.

7 Good Synergy With Other Characters

As A Tank, The Fighter Can Protect Other Allies

Right at the beginning of Avowed , players will find Kai, the first companion who permanently joins the party and who is also a tank. However, even though Kai has good attributes to defend the team, he is the only option in the game that focuses heavily on defense, so if players decide not to include him, allies might be left unprotected.

For this reason, the Fighter is one of the best classes in Avowed , since it provides great synergy with other companions who join the journey during the narrative, drawing enemy attention and applying different status effects. Marius and Giatta, for example, form a solid pair to travel with, as they offer useful ability synergies.

6 Fighter Have Access To Several Powerful Abilities

Charge Is One Of The Best Initial Skills In Avowed

Especially during the early game of Avowed , Fighters have access to abilities that can carry players if used well. For example, Charge, the first skill unlocked at level 1, offers good mobility to approach enemies quickly and also prevents blocks.

Other early abilities of the Fighter are also effective for crowd control, such as Shield Bash, which can stun or even interrupt enemy attacks. This grants a solid variety of skills that make the class an excellent choice in the first levels of Avowed due to what they provide in terms of gameplay.

5 It Is A Difficult Class To Be Defeated In Avowed

They Have Several Resources That Ensure Sustain In Battles

While a Wizard, for example, needs to worry about fragility in early levels, that is not the case for Fighters in Avowed . Right from first levels, they can access Toughness, a passive ability that gradually increases the protagonist’s HP, making them more resistant to attacks.

Another Fighter ability in Avowed that helps with sustain is Constant Recovery, which reduces the overall damage taken by restoring part of it after being hit. Therefore, for players who are less cautious or want more resilience, certain skill tree options for the class are essential.

4 Large Variety Of Weapons Available

Great For Players Who Want To Try Multiple Loadout Combinations

For those who do not want to stick with one weapon and prefer to switch options as the story progresses, fighters are the best choice. That is because Avowed provides a large variety of melee weapons, such as swords, axes, and maces, and fighters make the best use of them.

Even though Fighters do not have many buffs for one-handed weapons, for instance, they can still use some unique abilities with them, axes can stun enemies when used. In addition, shields can also be part of a Fighter’s arsenal, as they increase block effectiveness.

3 Fighters Have Access To Heavy Damage

This Class Can Easily Destroy Enemies In Close Combat

While Rangers and Wizards also offer strong damage output, especially at long range, Fighters are the perfect choice for players in Avowed who want to fight in close combat against foes. Additionally, they can deal massive damage and stun with their attacks, particularly when players opt for two-handed weapons.

However, what makes Fighters so effective in this new RPG from Obsidian is their ability to combine high damage output with strong defensive capabilities. Thus, while in combat, they need not worry about keeping distance from foes or their positioning, as their resilience compensates for a lack of caution.

2 Can Multiclass Very Well

Fighter Skills Have Great Synergy With Other Avowed Classes

In Avowed , players are not restricted to one class and can build their character by selecting skills from various options. This allows Fighters to become versatile by integrating Ranger or Wizard abilities, expanding their options for handling different types of enemies. Even though the Fighter’s special attacks may not always align perfectly with other classes, the natural resilience of the class remains valuable.

As a result, those who choose Fighter as an initial class in Avowed will not only enjoy its early game advantages but will also have good options for later on. However, anyone who wants to leverage the multiclass system in this Obsidian RPG should pick skills carefully so they work well together rather than reduce effectiveness.

1 Fighters Are A Good Beginner Class

They Have An Easy Learning Curve For New Players In Avowed

One of the best reasons to select Fighter as the initial class in Avowed is its beginner-friendly nature, which offers a straightforward introduction to several game mechanics. Newcomers to RPGs - and even to Obsidian’s games - will find this playstyle more focused on direct combat, without the need to dive into complex systems.

Additionally, the Fighter class in Avowed is tougher than most other available choices, making it a solid pick for those who want to survive longer in battles. Its gameplay is simpler too, so players can enjoy the game without the pressure of strategic decisions, such as choosing the best spells or ensuring precise aim with ranged attacks.

item.title: Genshin Impact: Xiangling Ascension and Talent Materials List
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Xiangling Mats at a Glance - Infographics
  • Xiangling Leveling Materials
  • Xiangling Ascension Materials
  • Xiangling Talent Materials
  • Xiangling Ascension Mats - Text Only Version
  • Xiangling Talent Materials - Text Only Version

Xiangling

Pyro

Polearm

Liyue

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

In Genshin Impact , it's not often that a free character is also a high-tier character. Fortunately, Xiangling is an exception to that trend. This Pyro Vision holder is available to anyone who clears Chamber 3, Floor 3 of the Spiral Abyss, and she's a very good fighter to have in combat.

With her friend Guoba and her handy polearm, Xiangling can dominate on the battlefield. In order to make her as powerful as possible, players will need to ascend Xiangling and upgrade her talents, both of which require quite a few items and a ton of Mora . Here's everything needed to level up Xiangling, ascend her, and power up her three upgradeable talents.

Xiangling Mats at a Glance - Infographics

Xiangling Leveling Materials

Free or otherwise, every Genshin Impact character needs the same amount of EXP and Mora to reach level 90.

Here's how much is needed between each ascension level:

Level

EXP

Mora

1-20

120,175

24,200

20-40

578,325

115,800

40-50

579,100

116,000

50-60

854,125

171,000

60-70

1,195,925

239,200

70-80

1,611,875

322,400

80-90 (max)

3,423,125

684,800

Totals:

8,362,650 EXP

1,673,400 Mora

Xiangling Ascension Materials

Xiangling is a fiery woman, and she fittingly needs several fiery items for her ascension, like spicy Jueyun Chilis and the flaming Everflame Seed. For a text-only version, click here.

Totals

--------------------------------------------------------

Ascension #1 at Character Level 20

Ascension #2 at Character Level 40

Ascension #3 at Character Level 50

Ascension #4 at Character Level 60

Ascension #5 at Character Level 70

Ascension #6 at Character Level 80

Gemstones - Where to Find Agnidus Agate

Xiangling is, fittingly, a Pyro character, since she's a cook who travels alongside the Stove God, who is now Guoba. As a result, she'll need some of the Pyro elemental stone, Agnidus Agate, to ascend.

Much of the Agnidus Agate players collect will be from bosses, but it can also be earned as a reward for finishing daily commissions, purchased from the souvenir shops in Liyue and Mondstadt, and obtained through some other methods as well.

Here are the bosses that can drop Agnidus Agate:

  • Pyro Regisvine
  • Pyro Hypostasis
  • Primo Geovishap*
  • Algorithm of Semi-Intransient Matrix of Overseer Network
  • Iniquitous Baptist
  • Emperor of Fire and Iron
  • Legatus Golem
  • Goldflame Qucusaur Tyrant
  • Tenebrous Papilla
  • Andrius (The Wolf of the North Challenge)
  • Azhdaha (Beneath the Dragon Queller)*
  • La Signora (Narukami Island: Tenshukaku)
  • The Knave (Scattered Ruins)

*Azhdaha and the Primo Geovishap can only drop Agnidus Agate when they're aligned with Pyro.

Read More: Genshin Impact: Where To Get Agnidus Agate

Enemy Drop - Where to Find Slime Drops

Slimes are found basically anywhere you look in Teyvat, which is great because a few characters need Slime materials to ascend, including Xiangling.

Like every other common enemy drop, higher-level Slimes will drop higher-level materials.

  • Any level Slime: Slime Condensate
  • Level 40 or higher Slimes: Slime Secretions
  • Level 60 or higher Slimes: Slime Concentrate

Boss Drop - How to Get Everflame Seeds

The Pyro Regisvine in Liyue can be found on Cuijue Slope in the Minlin Region. Players hoping to ascend Xiangling will need to take it down a few times. This is because it's the only source of Everflame Seeds, which are used in Xiangling's ascension.

Local Specialty - Where to Find Jueyun Chili

This item is typically used as a cooking ingredient, but interestingly, Xiangling uses it as the local specialty in her ascension. This is also fitting, as she's both a cook and a Pyro character, so a spicy food is perfect.

Jueyun Chilis can be found in a few places. They appear in large numbers around Qingce Village, around Minlin, especially on Jueyun Karst, and near the Stone Gate between Liyue and Mondstadt.

They can also be grown in the Serenitea Pot or purchased from Chef Mao, who is — funny enough — Xiangling's father. He stocks five of them every three days and charges 1,000 Mora for each one.

Xiangling Talent Materials

Xiangling's talents allow her to wield her Pyro Vision and polearm to deadly effect. They can be made even more powerful by upgrading them, using the following items.

For a text-only version of Xiangling's talent materials, click here.

Totals (1 Talent / 2 Talents / 3 Talents)

--------------------------------------------------------

Talent Level 1 -> 2

Talent Level 2 -> 3

Talent Level 3 -> 4

Talent Level 4 -> 5

Talent Level 5 -> 6

Talent Level 6 -> 7

Talent Level 7 -> 8

Talent Level 8 -> 9

Talent Level 9 -> 10 (max)

Talent Books - Diligence

A handful of characters use the Diligence series to upgrade their talents, including Xiangling , her fellow Pyro polearm user Hu Tao , top-tier DPS unit Ganyu , and more. To obtain them, clear the Taishan Mansion domain on Tuesdays, Fridays, or Sundays.

Trounce Materials

The trounce material Xiangling uses to upgrade her talents is Dvalin's Claw. This item is obtained by defeating Stormterror/Dvalin during his weekly trounce challenge.

Xiangling Ascension Mats - Text Only Version

You may need to scroll left and right to see the whole table, especially on mobile.

Gems

item.title: Pokemon Crosses Over with Portal in Mecha Umbreon Fanart
item.description:
Summary

  • Fan merges Pokemon with Portal game into Mecha Umbreon concept, creating unique fanart twist.
  • Mecha Umbreon fanart showcases clever use of portals, impressing fans with robotic design.
  • Artist has created mecha forms for other Eeveelutions, showing potential for more creative Pokemon fanart.

A creative Pokemon fan has shared their concept for a Mecha Umbreon that crosses over the iconic Pokemon with the Valve Portal game. The unique Pokemon fanart twist cleverly plays with the coloring that Umbreon has in both its standard and Shiny versions.

Although it's been a long time since Eevee got a new evolution, the line of Pokemon remains extremely popular with fans. Eevee is considered to be pretty cute, and since Pokemon fans can evolve it in so many different ways, it's likely that most Pokemon trainers have a favorite Eeveelution. While their base evolutions are great on their own, some fans have taken the initiative to make them even more interesting.

Over on Reddit, artist shunixe has shared their design for a Mecha Umbreon, which shows the Pokemon split in half, courtesy of portals that it's using. The back half of Umbreon, which has Shiny Umbreon's blue stripes, is disappearing into a blue portal, while a yellow portal in front of it shows the front half of the Umbreon poking through, which has yellow stripes akin to its standard form. The mecha design itself is impressive, with Umbreon looking like it's made out of robotic parts, but the clever nod to Umbreon's colors looking similar to the colors used for portals in Portal is particularly neat.

Portal and Pokemon Fans Collide

Numerous fans have commented on the work, quoting classic lines from Portal , like telling the artist that they're thinking with portals or saying "this was a triumph" while complimenting the artwork. One fan pointed out that Umbreon has poisonous sweat, which could even tie into the deadly neurotoxin that Portal players are threatened with when GLaDOS tries to kill the player in the first game. While Pokemon and Valve games have never had a crossover of any kind, it's interesting to think about what could be created if it were to happen.

For fans of the mecha styling of this particular Pokemon, this is just the latest mecha take on an Eeveelution that this artist has shared. This artist has already created mecha forms for Eevee, Vaporeon, and Leafeon. It's likely that they'll continue working on new Eeveelutions in this style, though they've also created other types of Pokemon fanart that don't have that mecha twist. In any case, it seems that the fandom is receptive to their work, so it will be interesting to see what they design next, and which Eeveelution will get a mecha version next.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Fans Are Torn on One Season 15 Change
item.description:
Summary

  • Overwatch 2 Season 15 brings UI changes.
  • The UI now mirrors the original Overwatch, with a new menu design that replaces the old mode select screen.
  • While some like the menu changes, others prefer the previous design.

The hotly anticipated 15th season of Overwatch 2 is now live and brings a wide variety of additions and changes to the game, including a UI alteration that has fans split on whether it's an improvement. The latest season of Overwatch 2 is certainly a big one for the game, with the recent Overwatch Spotlight event getting fans excited over the addition of hero perks, the return of loot boxes, a selection of new cosmetics, and more.

The game's latest season is an interesting one, bringing Overwatch 2 yet another step closer to the original game in many ways while simultaneously evolving the experience into something unlike anything fans will have ever seen before. While the team behind the game has made it clear that Overwatch 2 will be seeing even further new content later in the year that will introduce even more ambitious styles of play, with the launch of Season 15, players will be able to try out the hero perks system for the first time. While there are plenty of examples, this will allow players to upgrade their hero's abilities over the course of a match - for instance, being able to add armor to allies as Torbjorn by whacking them with a hammer.

While there are bound to be a good few hero perks that will soon have fans in hot debate, one minor change to the game has already caught the community's attention. The change is purely an aesthetic one and replaces the Overwatch 2 mode select screen with one that more closely resembles the one featured in the original Overwatch , mimicking the same card art style and font used in that game. It also now features Doomfist as the hero on the face of the competitive mode card instead of Winston, with the Arcade mode card replacing the Kiriko model with some cute art of an arcade claw machine, which uses Torbjorn's cybernetic hand as the claw. A post shared online by PoggersMemesReturns shows off this updated menu screen.

Overwatch 2 Fans Are Split On Whether This UI Update is an Improvement

The new menu also shrinks the hero mastery mode into a smaller tab that sits on the side along with the custom games, PvE missions, and training tabs. This isn't the first UI change that Overwatch 2 has introduced to help give its menus that distinctive classic Overwatch look, with the game previously overhauling its main menu screen and restoring the old text font. However, fans are surprisingly split over this change, with some preferring the new UI style that Overwatch 2 introduced with its release.

Still, Overwatch 2 does seem to be picking up a noticeable resurgence in popularity in light of its recent Spotlight livestream event. The return of loot boxes to Overwatch 2 is an update that fans are particularly pleased with and solves one of the game's largest underlying issues by giving fans a method of reliably earning cosmetics for free.
